page.title: 07CONSERVING OLD BUILDINGS
page.content: At La Platte Rocque there is a house which was to be turned into a restaurant. But a lady started a petition against it. She said it would disturb the beach and the fishing as well as spoil some historic buildings. They would have knocked down the round tower and German bunker which are there still. The tower is built out of granite and the bunker is made out of concrete. The front of the nearby house would have been made more modern and the windows would have been made bigger. In front of the house are some plants, shrubs and turf. Those would have been dug up and the front would have become tarmac. There is also a wall which would have been knocked down for a large entrance. But luckily the petition succeeded.
